attributes.action: STOP the closure of another A&E department in the North East...
attributes.background: Proposals would see A&E departments across Teesside, Durham and Darlington reduced from four to three; putting additional pressure on existing services.  Contradicting the Government’s pledge to ‘improve the health of the country’ and 'making services easier for patients to access'.
attributes.additional_details: The loss of local A&E Services in Hartlepool in 2011, has already caused unnecessary hardship and inconvenience for patients who now travel to Stockton to access A&E.  The road infrastructure (A19 / A66) is inadequate; causing delays for ambulances and patients, potentially causing unnecessary deaths.  The remaining four A&E Departments serve Hartlepool, Stockton, Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland and Darlington, with a total population of 662,800 (2011 Census).

attributes.action: Accept & publish on website all Petitions associated with UK EU referendum
attributes.background:
Little debate in parliament regarding all the implications of the UK leaving EU prior 23 June 2016 Referendum

UK petition website should accept all submitted petitions regardless of whether assessor assumes similar to another petition. Exiting EU is highly complex all petitions require debate.
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens should have been aware of positives & negatives of UK leaving EU prior voting

Petition assessor rejected "Agree in leaving the EU, negotiate continued Free Movement for All UK citizens."
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/157571
Petition rejected grounds claiming similar to another petition  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/135700

All EU referendum petitions need open debate. Simply rejecting petitions on assumption similar when issues highly complex is undemocratic.

attributes.action: Improve young voter turnout: polling stations in universities and colleges
attributes.background: Young voters are statistically proven to have a poorer turnout to elections than older voters, despite having to live longer with the results. In order to improve young voter turnout, improving accessibility to polling stations by putting them in educational institutions ought to be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2014/10/economist-explains-24

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/28/young-people-bad-voting-millennials-eu-vote-politics

https://next.ft.com/content/1ce1a720-ce94-3c32-a689-8d2356388a1f

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Call a general election or allow a vote on repealing the Communities Act 1972.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to either call a general election or ensure that there is a vote in parliament for repealing the European Communities Act 1972 before invoking Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
We feel that you owe the electorate and/or Parliament a choice given that :-

Scotland, Northern Ireland, Gibraltar, London and 75% of MPs all voted to remain.

The UK Leave majority was slim, so there is not a strong mandate to leave.

There is currently no leadership in either of the main parties.

There is a constitutional crisis which threatens the breakup of two Unions.

That the defacto leader of the Leave campaign will not stand as PM.

attributes.action: Conscientious objection to military taxation
attributes.background: I no longer want to pay the percentage of taxes that are used to fund military budget. I feel that I am indirectly funding the killing of others. I am morally against this and no longer want to contribute to it through conscientious objection to military taxation.
attributes.additional_details: Conscientious objection to military tax is thought to be an extension to objection to military service. A person with a religious or ethical scruple against taking part in killing people during war is likely to feel no less scruple about paying somebody else to do the killing or about purchasing the mechanism of killing. If a government can respect the right of a person not to participate directly in making war, can it also respect the right of the person to avoid this indirect participation.

attributes.action: Majority should be of electorate in referenda, with provision for indecision
attributes.background: We call on parliament to ensure that referenda base the majority on the entire electorate rather than on turnout, and have provision for the scenario where the public as a whole is undecided. In which case, our elected MPs must continue the debate and consider rephrasing the question to the public.

attributes.action: Establish support mechanisms to aid people experiencing abuse due to Brexit.
attributes.background: This petition asks Parliament to urgently recommend putting in place visible resources (web, social & phone) so that members of the public who have been subject to abuse related to Brexit know where to turn to seek advice and the support of concerned and loving members of their community.
attributes.additional_details: Reports of members of the public being subjected to racial or xenophobic abuse has increased noticeably since Brexit. Mechanisms exist to report such hate crimes to the police but there is little visible information connecting the victim or scared member o/t public to volunteer groups representing caring individuals in the community or for those who wish to help, to join together. This issue needs a national voice and to be seen as the responsibility of all ordinary decent civilians.

attributes.action: We will not tolerate public acts of discrimination
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Govt. to increase punitive measures in response to public acts of aggressive, racial and xenophobic discrimination by 50% for a period of 1 year following the EU Referendum. We believe this will send the clear message that the People of Britain do not tolerate racism.
attributes.additional_details: In the wake of the EU referendum, the risk that racism and bigotry will show itself as an accepted part of our society is higher than ever. By signing this petition, you are calling on our Government to take official steps to show that we are not a racist, bigoted nation and will punish those who seek to do harm to another person because of their culture, religion, country of origin or ethnicity and those who seek to alienate  people along these lines during this political upheaval.

attributes.action: Create a clear legal framework for UK-wide referenda
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum highlighted the problems of using this democratic tool in the U.K,: a small majority, rejection by two home nations, and purely advisory in nature.
This vagueness, uncertainty, and unfairness is plainly unsatisfactory and must be addressed before any future referenda are held.
attributes.additional_details:
It is proposed that a referendum shall be binding on the Government if either of the following criteria is met:
- The votes for the winning side total at least 50% of the total number of those eligible to vote plus one, or
- The winning side is supported by simple majorities in at least three of the four home nations, and by at least two-thirds of the total votes cast.
In all other cases, the Government shall be required to take note of the result of the referendum, but is not bound by it.

attributes.action: Ask public about immigration before negotiating new EU deals
attributes.background: On June 23rd the UK voted to leave the EU. A number of public figures have suggested which factors swayed voters, but the question asked makes it impossible to know public opinion on specific issues. We believe the government cannot claim a mandate to negotiate a new deal without polling.
attributes.additional_details: Some have claimed that immigration was a key factor in the result, but it is impossible to say for certain that a majority of those who voted leave did so to prevent free movement of people. The government should take steps to more effectively gauge public opinion on the nature of Britain’s exit from the EU, so that it can act on facts, not speculation. The issues of environmental legislation, the EU arrest warrant, and the court of human rights should also be included in the poll.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for every new housing development to include vital services
attributes.background: At the moment in the UK were are facing a crisis - Public services are under strain. School places are in short supply as are doctors and other vital infrastructure. This IS NOT down to immigrants but the failure of councils and central government to ensure developers build these vital services.
attributes.additional_details: Developers need to take responsibility and build essential services into their sprawling developments to aide the struggling public services instead of grabbing as much profit as possible and ignoring the effect their builds are having on local services.

attributes.action: Raise the salary for childcare workers in the early years sector
attributes.background: Childcare workers in the early years have one of the most important jobs in the sector as a whole. They are responsible for the early education, health and wellbeing of children under 5. A rewarding job is there ever was one however this is not reflected in their salaries.
attributes.additional_details: The average full time childcare worker in the early years sector makes less than £1050 per month after deductions. This simply is not reflective of the love, hard work, sacrifice and determination to give the future the best possible start in life. As a childcare worker there is no greater joy than helping a child succeed at being a child and being happy, healthy and confident. But job satisfaction can only take you so far when a roof over your head is needed.

attributes.action: Bring back half day closing on a Wednesday and close full day Sunday
attributes.background: We should bring back half day and Sunday closing to help the economy and give more people family time as more places are open on the Internet

attributes.action: Stop Expatriates Having A Vote On British Issues Such As Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Just over 4.5 million Britons live abroad with approximately 1.3 million of them in Europe. Allowing them to vote on British issues severely alters the results of elections and referendums.
If Britain isn't good enough for them to live or pay Tax in then why should they have a say in how it is run?
attributes.additional_details:
We saw during the EU referendum over a million Spanish expats (selfishly) tried to vote 'stay' in Europe purely because they wanted to keep their NHS benefits abroad! Not for the good of the country.

Sign if you believe British Expats who do not live or pay Tax in the Britain should NOT be able to vote in Britain!

attributes.action: Ban all factory farmed food!
attributes.background: Every year more tHan 10 million pigs are killed in British slaughterhouses. The ones chosen for breeding are kept in stressful condition and are impregnated forcefully. Then their babies are taken from them. And that's just pigs.

attributes.action: Post Brexit UK must apologise for Biafran War.
attributes.background: When the state of Biafra tried to secede from Nigeria in 1967 to prevent the genocide of it's people, the UK supplied arms to the Nigerian Army which caused deaths of millions of innocent Biafrans, mostly through starvation. Biafrans have the same right as Britons to decide their own future.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1967, the leaders of Nigeria agreed to partition their own country into states that would reflect the ethnic origins of it's own people. However, UK, the former colonial ruler demanded that Nigeria must remain as one country. This cruel policy led directly to the blockading of Biafra and cause the deaths of millions of innocent people. 
Please watch 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fMehSE6kp4
and read 
https://markcurtis.wordpress.com/2007/02/13/nigeriabiafra-1967-70/

attributes.action: Before triggering Article 50 an initial UK-EU deal must be handled by Vote Leave
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, activation of Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty should only take place once an initial agreement, outlining key areas of the future relationship, has been reached between the UK and EU. The negotiation should be led by prominent members of the Vote Leave campaign.

attributes.action: Set out principles for any negotiation pertaining to leaving the European Union
attributes.background: Parliament should vote on a motion supporting access to European markets, free movement of people, and compatibility with major areas of European law. This being a move to boost confidence for business and markets, and to reassure the European citizens living and working in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently great uncertainty and anxiety both for business and financial markets, and for the many Europeans who live and work as part of our communities; friends, colleagues and loved ones. Parliament should act to create certainty and confidence, setting out the principles on which any negotiation should be based. This should include the key areas such as free movement, access to markets, and legal compatibility such topics as data protection.

attributes.action: Debate security implications of the removal of U.K. border controls from Calais.
attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.

attributes.action: Amend the Human Rights Act to support informed public debate.
attributes.background: Only when we have a clear view of issues can we make informed choice, people cannot make functional choices when they do not know what they are choosing. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.
attributes.additional_details: I propose an additional article under the UK Human Rights Act which prevents the dumbing down and obfuscation of public debate. It is the duty of public servants to bring clarity and accuracy to public debate to establish objectives and clean information both pro and con. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on whether the citizens of UK want the breakup of the UK.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the prospect that Northern Ireland and Scotland will leave the United Kingdom, and 48 % of people did not want the UK to leave the EU, this historic breakup of the UK should be the subject of a referendum.

attributes.action: Use Mixed-Member Proportional Representation to Elect the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Despite the most important question in an election being which party gets into power, you cannot vote directly for the party you favour. In many electorates, where the seat is safe, your vote doesn't matter at all.

MMP will give everyone a fairer say in government.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixed-member_proportional_representation

http://www.voterpower.org.uk/

attributes.action: Make tips tax free for waiters and waitresses.
attributes.background: Currently waiters and waitresses have to declare their tips to HMRC. These tips do not form part of the bill and are a thank you gift to the waiter or waitress for providing a great service and working unsociable hours. HMRC will still generate tax revenues from the bill.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing the waiter or waitress to take the money home that night will avoid unscrupulous employers charging them admin fees on tips or taking a share for breakages and spillages.

attributes.action: Glaucoma  patients who need their eye pressure  checked should not be charged.
attributes.background: At present Glaucoma patients can only have their eye pressure tests done once a year covered at NHS cost, if there is a need to monitor the eye pressure to prevent going blind

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to deny estranged parents to be denied access to kids
attributes.background: It should be law that the estranged partner, be automatically allowed access to their children. If they truly pose a risk to them, the onus should be with the partner the children reside with to go to court prove why they feel it is not in the children's best interest to see the other parent.
attributes.additional_details: This mainly affects estranged Fathers, and now there is no legal aide for family matters, and the fact CSA take up to 40% of their wage for maintainence that they have to pay despite them being denied any kind of relationship with their children, a lot of Fathers can't afford to go to court. This is not equality!! If the children are young they can't express their needs, the law needs to ensure they do not suffer. We have enough childhood Depression. We need to put the children first.

attributes.action: Stop the time limits on disabled and elderly bus passes.
attributes.background: The rules on a disabled or elderly bus pass is telling people who have them what times they can and can't take a bus journey Its discrimination and absolutely embarrassing to be turned away and declined to take your journey before 9am! Why have the bus pass holders got a bus pass curfew? Fair/Unfair
attributes.additional_details: Contact your local Council and ask for information on times you can use your bus pass. Its like we have to be controlled and they tell us what we can and can't do.

attributes.action: Give grandparents the same funding as foster parents whether they work or not
attributes.background: Payment for grandparents who have grandchildren fulltime.
attributes.additional_details: Me and my husband work but can only get child benefit for 2 grandchildren who live with us fulltime so if they need clothes or shoes or anything else and it is more than £34 we have to pay for it. I think there should be some sort of payment like foster parents get because grandparents are doing the same job.

attributes.action: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes
attributes.background: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes

attributes.action: Parliamentary Election To Take Place 3 Months After Brexit.
attributes.background: Brexit has had huge impact not only on the economy, but has been divisive to the nation/s... for many people both brexiteers and remainers many have lost a lot of faith in the government ability and do not feel the government can take us forward to unite us and recover the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since Brexit, the countries division has been deep routed... And many people feel like their voices are not being heard. The government has been acting unilaterally ignoring a significant number of the population.

This has left very little confidence in the government's ability to fairly treat it's citizens. 

And the only way our voices will be heard is by holding a general election, to lead us in a positive direction and change.

attributes.action: Increase the mental health budget now.
attributes.background: It's a serious issue and affects people’s physical health and the economy. Better prevention measures – access to therapies and support, faster referrals, more time to discuss with a GP versed in mental health – means better outcomes overall. We value mental health and the budget must reflect it!
attributes.additional_details: December 2016: Less and less being spent on mental health: Local authorities use less than 1% of their budget on services

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to at least 3.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: The number of combat ships in service is woefully low. This isn't acceptable for an island nation. We should have a steady return to 1985 levels , otherwise risk getting caught short , like nearly happened with the Falklands conflict.

attributes.action: Allow HMRC to provide tax exemptions where clerical errors have occurred
attributes.background: I dissolved a company rather than wound it up, and therefore HMRC is applying income tax rather than capital gains tax on the distributions. This was a clerical error, but there is no way to wind back the clock on such errors. HMRC should have the power to apply exemptions under such circumstances.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: treat addiction as a mental health problem rather than criminal justice problem
attributes.background: The war on drugs has been a war fought with misinformation. We should not punish addicts but treat their addiction and what they choose to escape from when under the influence of substance abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Chasing the scream by Johann Hari

attributes.action: Allow "hoverboards" to be used on pavements
attributes.background: Currently hoverboards are not allowed on the public pavements. Many countries such as the USA and other EU countries are allowing it and they are after all a useful mode of transport. Unfortunately an out of date highways act says that we can't and it's high tide this is changed.

attributes.action: Placejob seekers on work programs within 6weeks of oringially signing on
attributes.background: To change the official help and courses job seekers receive down to 6 weeks of being unemployed rather than 6 months - the government needs to recognise that just because that a person has only just signed on, they may have been out of work a lot longer.

attributes.action: Introducing a theory test with Motorcycle Compulsory basic training
attributes.background: Motorcycles are an increasing form of transport, from delivery, commuting to pleasure. New motorcycle riders with no experience can legally ride without adequate training. Learner Motorcycle riders do not need to pass a theory test, producing inconsiderate, dangerous riders with poor road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislation states that a rider, whether young, old and of all level of experiences can learn to ride a motorcycle on the roads by simply completing a Compulsory basic training course. 
This consists of a manoeuvring and bike control session, then a road competence ride which is supervised.
During the CBT an instructor will assess your knowledge of the Highway code. This is not enough, too many riders put themselves at risk by not fully understanding the rules of the road.

attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: Ensure that Boxing Day is held specifically on 26th December. Day after Xmas day
attributes.background: If 26 Dec is on a Sun, Boxing Day in the UK is moved to 27 Dec. In the UK, Boxing Day is a bank holiday. If Boxing Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is a substitute bank holiday. On occasion when Xmas Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is Boxing Day and Tue a substitute bank holiday for Xmas.
attributes.additional_details:
The intention is to fix Boxing Day to the 26th Dec regardless of what day it falls on so that it is observed formally as a national holiday.

This would mean that if Boxing Day falls on a Saturday or a Sunday, that day is observed as Boxing Day and (Sunday) the Day of Rest is observed on the Monday instead.

This Petition is about recognising the priorities and people and how times have changed. Boxing Day would be given priority over business and Sunday day of rest.

attributes.action: Stop Private Railway Operators from wheel clamping under Railway Byelaw14
attributes.background: Vehicle clamping by private companies was deemed illegal in England and Wales in October 2012. However, Private Railway Operators can still legally exploit an old Railway Byelaw(14) which allows them to continue an aggressive campaign against railway passengers parking in their car parks.
attributes.additional_details:
They enlist private Contractors to handle this duty, and as a result, are generating thousands of pounds in revenue from excessive use of wheel clamping and by applying disproportionate penalties and release costs, for aggressive commercial gain.

Its time this ended, so please sign this petition if you believe the Department of Transport should take action, to ensure Railway Operators and their private clamping Contractors have to abide by the same Laws as anywhere else in the Country.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to fill out military medical forms within 48 hours.
attributes.background: Military applicants rely on their doctor to fill out a medical form involving medical history of the applicant. However doctors tend to sit on this paperwork for weeks, delaying the applicants entry process (which is very frustrating).
attributes.additional_details: Doctors get payed by the army, navy, airforce to fill these forms out and still sit on them for weeks even though many forms come with an urgent warning.

attributes.action: Stop HS2
attributes.background: Stop HS2 destroying our green belt and countryside

attributes.action: Get Britain to join the North Atlantic Free Trade Area
attributes.background: Britain has left the undemocratic and overbearing EU but we still need to trade with the rest of the world.  So lets join NAFTA and not have to worry about a NAFTA parliament or "ever closer integration".

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Introduce a living will the right to die if diagnose of Alzheimer or dementia
attributes.background:
I am 75 years of age and  I am in good health and sound of mind. I don't want to end my days where I don't know family and friends and I can't do anything for myself ie speak, wash, walk or feed myself. So
 I therefore want the right to die when two doctors say that I have no quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
I have friends and relatives that have either Alzheimer's or dementia. They don't know anybody, they can't feed themselves or wash or go the toilet and some can't even speak.They are just waiting to die, some of them have been like this for more than two years. In the early stages I was told by some of them that they wanted this option and die with dignity
there is no cure for these illnesses

attributes.action: Equality and fairness : Child Benefit system
attributes.background: Separated parents (with parental responsibility) that have shared custody of their children should be allowed to have an equal share in the benefits received for the children; the current system only allows one person to claim for child benefit.

attributes.action: Carbon emissions tax
attributes.background: For all UK tax payers to pay a tax of £7.50 each month of the year. Which then all money goes towards renewable energy and eventually lowers payroll tax.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone pollutes therefore everyone has a responsibility to on saving are great nation and doing our bit for the world. With the £7.50 month tax this means there will be an extra £195 Million pounds to renewable energy and research and development and in a year an extra £2.3 Billion pounds towards it!

attributes.action: Restrict all heavy lorries with speed limiters to one lane on motorways.
attributes.background: As heavy vehicles are fitted with speed limiters, overtaking can take several miles and cause congestion and tailback to vehicles without speed restrictors.
attributes.additional_details: The effect is to cause congestion and tailbacks to other motorway users.
